answers.answer: I'd sure suggest talking to your GP and see where that leads you.  Once he/she has ideas, I'd suggest you take the first step to solving anger and anxiety issues by following directions.  Keep us informed, thanks for posting

question: Hello everyone.What I know for sure:I suffer from anxiety.I'm sure I have some explosive anger issues.About 8 months ago I had triglicerides at 300.I suffer from GERD.My grandma was hospitalized with pulmonary fibrosis.  So that's been really stressful.  My family and I drove cross country to visit her.  The drive itself was also stressful.  My step kids are driving me nuts.  During the drive one of then urinated all over my leather seats.  His urine is so horrendous smelling. So much so I have to take him to the doctors because either he is dehydrated or has diabetes.Anyway, I'm stressed out.  And am experiencing some chest pains.  It's on the left side of my chest.Tomorrow I will make an appointment to the doctors.  I want them to run as many tests as needed.  What I want to know is what is the most probable cause of my chest pain?  I have been under a lot of stress but I know my diet and exercise habits could be better.
title: Angina: High Cholesterol and/or Stress
